id: credit event triggered when one or more reference obligations become immediately due and payable as a result of a default or covenant breach on the reference entity's other debt instruments, subject to a materiality threshold
name: credit event triggered when one or more reference obligations become immediately due and payable as a result of a default or covenant breach on the reference entity's other debt instruments, subject to a materiality threshold

id: Note that this may be a period denominated in business days or calendar days.
name: Note that this may be a period denominated in business days or calendar days.

id: CreditEvents.rdf version of this ontology was revised to move a restriction involving breach of covenant from credit event, since not all credit events involve breaches, to default event, and loosen the constraint since a breach depends on the contract.
name: CreditEvents.rdf version of this ontology was revised to move a restriction involving breach of covenant from credit event, since not all credit events involve breaches, to default event, and loosen the constraint since a breach depends on the contract.

id: entity-specific credit event involving a temporary suspension of payments until related issues are resolved
name: entity-specific credit event involving a temporary suspension of payments until related issues are resolved

id: CreditEvents.rdf version of this ontology was modified to move the property, 'is conferred on' to the Legal Capacity ontology and to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC), eliminating redundancies in FIBO as appropriate.
name: CreditEvents.rdf version of this ontology was modified to move the property, 'is conferred on' to the Legal Capacity ontology and to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC), eliminating redundancies in FIBO as appropriate.

id: window following any payment due date during which a party must fulfill its obligations before a failure to pay credit event occurs
name: window following any payment due date during which a party must fulfill its obligations before a failure to pay credit event occurs

id: credit event triggered when the credit rating of a party or obligation is lowered
name: credit event triggered when the credit rating of a party or obligation is lowered

id: indicates that the restructuring spans more than one credit event
name: indicates that the restructuring spans more than one credit event

id: A moratorium may be a legally-mandated hiatus in debt collection as a part of a bankruptcy process.
name: A moratorium may be a legally-mandated hiatus in debt collection as a part of a bankruptcy process.

id: default event involving non-payment of several installment payments as scheduled in the terms of the agreement, or non-payment of a call by the beneficial owner
name: default event involving non-payment of several installment payments as scheduled in the terms of the agreement, or non-payment of a call by the beneficial owner

id: As stipulated in the terms and conditions for a bond, for example, the issuer or the bondholder may prolong the maturity date. After extension, the security may differ from original issue (new rate or maturity date). May be subject to bondholder's approval.
name: As stipulated in the terms and conditions for a bond, for example, the issuer or the bondholder may prolong the maturity date. After extension, the security may differ from original issue (new rate or maturity date). May be subject to bondholder's approval.

id: credit event that involves a request to a court to be recognized as bankrupt
name: credit event that involves a request to a court to be recognized as bankrupt

id: credit event triggered when the credit rating of an obligation is downgraded to a distressed debt level
name: credit event triggered when the credit rating of an obligation is downgraded to a distressed debt level

id: CreditEvents.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.
name: CreditEvents.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.

id: default event that is triggered following any applicable grace period in which a payment obligation is missed
name: default event that is triggered following any applicable grace period in which a payment obligation is missed

id: credit event that relates to an individual credit agreement or debt instrument (reference obligation)
name: credit event that relates to an individual credit agreement or debt instrument (reference obligation)

id: credit event involving the refusal to honor the terms of a contract
name: credit event involving the refusal to honor the terms of a contract

id: If the default is not repaired within a grace period, then a failure to repair (failure to pay) credit event is triggered, potentially as a hard default.
name: If the default is not repaired within a grace period, then a failure to repair (failure to pay) credit event is triggered, potentially as a hard default.

id: Barron's Dictionary of Banking Terms, Sixth Edition, 2012
name: Barron's Dictionary of Banking Terms, Sixth Edition, 2012

id: A default can occur when a borrower is unable to make timely payments, misses payments, or avoids or stops making payments, typically with respect to a single transaction. A default has adverse effects on the borrower's credit and ability to borrow in the future, and allows the creditor to demand immediate repayment of the obligation in full.
name: A default can occur when a borrower is unable to make timely payments, misses payments, or avoids or stops making payments, typically with respect to a single transaction. A default has adverse effects on the borrower's credit and ability to borrow in the future, and allows the creditor to demand immediate repayment of the obligation in full.

id: CreditEvents.rdf version of this ontology was modified to replace content that is now available in the OMG Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FND-380).
name: CreditEvents.rdf version of this ontology was modified to replace content that is now available in the OMG Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FND-380).

id: The bankruptcy process is initiated via a petition filed by the debtor or on behalf of creditors. The debtor's assets may be used to repay a portion of outstanding debt as specified by the court or a court-appointed individual.
name: The bankruptcy process is initiated via a petition filed by the debtor or on behalf of creditors. The debtor's assets may be used to repay a portion of outstanding debt as specified by the court or a court-appointed individual.

id: On October 17, 2013, Dagong Global Credit Rating downgraded the United States from A to A- and maintained a negative outlook on the country's credit.
name: On October 17, 2013, Dagong Global Credit Rating downgraded the United States from A to A- and maintained a negative outlook on the country's credit.

id: credit event involving a change in state or condition in which a party becomes insolvent
name: credit event involving a change in state or condition in which a party becomes insolvent

id: credit event that materially impacts an obligation, such as an interest rate reduction, principal reduction, deferral of interest or principal, change in priority ranking, or change in currency or composition of payment
name: credit event that materially impacts an obligation, such as an interest rate reduction, principal reduction, deferral of interest or principal, change in priority ranking, or change in currency or composition of payment

id: obligation-specific credit event whereby the book value of the obligation, such as the outstanding principal amount, is reduced
name: obligation-specific credit event whereby the book value of the obligation, such as the outstanding principal amount, is reduced

id: indicates whether or not the grace period may be extended, which may be jurisdiction specific
name: indicates whether or not the grace period may be extended, which may be jurisdiction specific

id: default event that is not repairable
name: default event that is not repairable

id: credit event that applies to a given legal person
name: credit event that applies to a given legal person

id:
This ontology defines a range of credit events, that is events in which some payment or payments are not made. These include credit events relating to a specific debt obligation and events relating to the business entity as a whole. 
		Note: the events defined herein are primarily business rather than consumer oriented, and are specified fairly generally. Many credit events are jurisdiction-specific, such as Chapter 11 restructuring and Chapter 7 bankruptcy in the United States. This ontology is designed to facilitate jurisdiction and instrument-specific extensions as needed.
name:
This ontology defines a range of credit events, that is events in which some payment or payments are not made. These include credit events relating to a specific debt obligation and events relating to the business entity as a whole. 
		Note: the events defined herein are primarily business rather than consumer oriented, and are specified fairly generally. Many credit events are jurisdiction-specific, such as Chapter 11 restructuring and Chapter 7 bankruptcy in the United States. This ontology is designed to facilitate jurisdiction and instrument-specific extensions as needed.

id: default event that where either an expected interest payment is missed altogether or the amount paid is less than the required amount
name: default event that where either an expected interest payment is missed altogether or the amount paid is less than the required amount

id: credit event representing a failure to meet a contractual obligation, such as failure to repay a debt including interest or principal on a loan or security
name: credit event representing a failure to meet a contractual obligation, such as failure to repay a debt including interest or principal on a loan or security

id: CreditEvents.rdf version of this ontology was revised to address text formatting issues uncovered by hygiene testing.
name: CreditEvents.rdf version of this ontology was revised to address text formatting issues uncovered by hygiene testing.

id: credit event triggered as a result of an obligation-specific default
name: credit event triggered as a result of an obligation-specific default

id: default event that where either an expected principal payment is missed altogether or the amount paid is less than the required amount
name: default event that where either an expected principal payment is missed altogether or the amount paid is less than the required amount

id: event signifying a sudden change in credit standing, such as bankruptcy or a violation of a bond indenture or loan agreement, that raises doubts about the party's ability to meet current or future obligations
name: event signifying a sudden change in credit standing, such as bankruptcy or a violation of a bond indenture or loan agreement, that raises doubts about the party's ability to meet current or future obligations

id: or a forfeit of partially paid securities.
name: or a forfeit of partially paid securities.

id: CreditEvents.rdf version of this ontology was revised to augment the definition of obligation-specific event with an optional default threshold to better support credit default swaps.
name: CreditEvents.rdf version of this ontology was revised to augment the definition of obligation-specific event with an optional default threshold to better support credit default swaps.

id: credit event involving extension of payments beyond the original maturity date of the obligation
name: credit event involving extension of payments beyond the original maturity date of the obligation
